ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: By taking this course, I learned not only how to strengthen my academic writing, but to create work that is meaningful to me. I was able to explore my interests both inside and outside of the classroom through this class and create a deeper understanding of my own creative voice.

Taking this course expands your knowledge on the definition and perception of voice. It goes beyond physiological aspect of voice. Voice is found in music, in silence, in dance, and more. The projects and papers that were required for the course has helped me improve drastically in my writing while learning to utilize other forms of technology and software.
I developed a new ability to tackle complex readings with challenging concepts and more importantly being able to utilize these complex topics in a persuasive written piece.
By taking this course, I think that I improved my overall writing skills.
I learned how to write an academic paper at Yale.

I enjoyed learning about the different components of a voice as well looking in depth of something we take for granted every single day. A voice can be composed of many different things with different meaning and sounds. It can be spoken, acted out, expressed, and even be silent. We were able to compartmentalize and expand upon what makes a voice throughout the semester which I enjoyed! A voice is what you make of it and as long as your able to communicate in any sort of way it is a voice which is what we found ultimately through the corse. A voice  is what makes us human and connects us all. It makes us more expressive and unique creatures beacuse we can find a voice in everything.
None.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths of this course are its various disciplines within the academic discussion and the creative freedom afforded to students. The weakness of the course for me personally was the early meeting time.
The strengths of this course is that you learn a lot about voice and interpretation through several mediums and several cultures.
I think I became significantly more versed in my ability to unwrap complex arguments in philosophical readings .
The instructor was excellent and really advanced my understanding of how to write a college essay.
Some of the readings/videos given were longer than necessary. The feedback I got on my papers was very helpful.
This course is very subjective. Truly no right or wrong answers.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Professor T is an amazing professor who has a genuine care for her students. Her class is thought provoking and engaging, and your writing will improve tremendously throughout the semester.

I would recommend this course to another student, especially if they are into music, literature, culture studies, and philosophy. Although this is an English course, the discussion of the many aspects of voice touches upon all these topics.
Absolutely, though it tackles a very specific topic (voices) the instructor was passionate about it and showed how in depth one can take such a specific topic
Yes, I would recommend this course to another student because it helped me improve my writing skills but the workload was not too overwhelming.
Yes, it was a great introduction to writing academic papers are Yale. Professor Tu was kind and gave very helpful feedback on every paper.

Yes, It makes you thing differently about the world and voices which make us all human and living. This corse is a great way to get introduced into yale writing as well. This makes for a great course to get a great grade as long as you put time and effort into the readings, papers, and engaging in the class material.
No , I truly did not enjoy the topic of conversation this class was based off of.
